thread.title: Manchester United 0-0 Hull City PLAYER RATINGS - Who was your Man of the Match from Old Trafford?
thread.title_full: Manchester United 0-0 Hull City PLAYER RATINGS - Who was your Man of the Match from Old Trafford?

author: David McDonnell
title: Manchester United 0-0 Hull City PLAYER RATINGS - Who was your Man of the Match from Old Trafford?
text:
Hull City's Eldin Jakupovic reaches to save from Manchester United's Tom Lawrence (Photo: AFP) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Manchester United failed to beat Hull for the second time in six days as their Champions League hopes took another hit at Old Trafford. 
Jose Mourinho watched his side draw for the ninth time in the Premier League this season as they failed to find a way past Eldin Jakupovic. 
The home side had the better of the chances but neither Paul Pogba or Zalatan Ibrahimovic could beat the Swiss international. 
Marco SIlva's side on the other hand earned a valuable point which lifted them off the bottom of the table, and gives them renewed hope in their bid to stay up. 
Here are our player ratings: Jose Mourinho looks downbeat during his side's draw against Hull (Photo: Julian Finney) Manchester United 
Untroubled with Hull offering little in attack. 
Valencia 6 
Didnâ€™t push forward as much as he usually does. 
Jones 7 
Commanding in defence. Forced off injured after break. Phil Jones played well before going off injured (Photo: Getty) 
Rojo 6 
Headed over in first-half. Crucial tackle on Markovic. 
Blind 5 
First start for a couple of games and showed at times. 
Carrick 6 
Sacrificed for Rooney at the break as United went for it. Paul Pogba runs with the ball as Tom Huddlestone pursues (Photo: Getty) 
Herrera 7 
Great ball to put Mkhitaryan through on goal early on. 
Pogba 6 
Saw a first-half goal-bound effort saved by Jakupovic. 
Mkhitaryan 6 
Tried to get things going for United but struggled. Subbed. Marcus Rashford, making his first Premier League start since November, breaks with the ball (Photo: REUTERS) 
Ibrahimovic 7 
Went close with long-range shot saved by Jakupovic. 
Rashford 6 
Some pacey runs. Fluffed chance early in the second-half. Zlatan Ibrahimovic holds off Hull defender David Meyler (Photo: Getty)
